subject: Re: FW: Flock LPR stolen / damaged
body:
[EXTERNAL ?]

Hi @DEWITT Derek A ddewitt@eugene-or.gov   

Just to confirm for this 2nd camera, was the solar panel also stolen or another situation happened to this camera? 

Thank you 

On Wed, Jun 4, 2025 at 8:49?AM DEWITT Derek A <DDeWitt@eugene-or.gov DDeWitt@eugene-or.gov > wrote:


	This is the one that was discovered today

	 

	P#010 Hilyard St @ E 24th Ave NB

	Serial: 240926P0210017M

	 

	The other one is in the forwarded email.

	 

	Derek

	 

	Detective D. DeWitt

	Financial Crimes Unit

	Special Weapons and Tactics Team

	Background Investigations Team

	Eugene Police Department

	300 County Club Road

	Eugene, OR 97401

	Work hours: Tuesday - Friday 7:30 a.m. � 5:30 p.m.

	Desk Phone � 541-682-2682

	Work Cell � 541-743-6192

	 

	From: Flock Safety Support <support@flocksafety.com support@flocksafety.com > 
	Sent: Tuesday, June 3, 2025 1:09 PM
	To: DEWITT Derek A <DDeWitt@eugene-or.gov DDeWitt@eugene-or.gov >
	Cc: gaby.mahoney@flocksafety.com gaby.mahoney@flocksafety.com 
	Subject: Re: Flock LPR stolen / damaged

	 

	[EXTERNAL ?]

	Good afternoon Detective,

	 

	Thank you for reaching out per the contract Eugene PD is the victim. This is an interesting situation as location P#043 W 29th Ave @ Willamette St WB is a new install. It's been installed a bit over two weeks. We do waive the fees for reinstallation for location implemented within 30 days. 

	 

	I have a few questions to ensure this process goes smoothly:

	1.	Here is a link to the reinstall fee schedule https://www.flocksafety.com/reinstall-fee-schedule . Reinstallation will cost $500 (includes the pole, solar panel replacement, and technician visit. Do we have permission to move forward with replacing the equipment? And would you like us to waive the fees as mentioned or would you like us to invoice after reinstallation to go after the perpetrator? If the PD does want to be invoiced, it will be emailed to ap@ci.eugene.or.us ap@ci.eugene.or.us  upon reinstallation.
	2.	Is the Flock pole still on site? If yes, please leave it as is; this will be a marker for 811 digging approval needs.
	3.	Is all other equipment (i.e. the camera) still on site? If so, please leave all equipment as is. If not, please confirm the address where we can pick up the equipment, and if there is anything we should reference/someone we should ask for upon doing so; we understand that personnel availability changes frequently in a public safety setting, so we are happy to connect with administrative staff to obtain equipment if they have a more flexible schedule.

	Regarding the heartbeat of the camera after it was removed, it probably still had power stored from the solar panel. 

	 

	Stay safe,

	George

	 

	 

	--------------- Original Message ---------------
	From: Flock Safety Support [support@flocksafety.com support@flocksafety.com ]
	Sent: 6/2/2025, 9:59 AM
	To: gaby.mahoney@flocksafety.com gaby.mahoney@flocksafety.com 
	Cc: ddewitt@eugene-or.gov ddewitt@eugene-or.gov 
	Subject: Re: Flock LPR stolen / damaged

	Hi there,

	Thank you for reaching out! We have a team that specializes in damage cases. I am connecting you with them for further assistance. You should hear back soon.

	Thank you, and stay safe,
	Chelsea

	 

	 

	--------------- Original Message ---------------
	From: Gaby Mahoney [gaby.mahoney@flocksafety.com gaby.mahoney@flocksafety.com ]
	Sent: 5/29/2025, 1:54 PM
	To: ddewitt@eugene-or.gov ddewitt@eugene-or.gov 
	Cc: support@flocksafety.com support@flocksafety.com 
	Subject: Re: Flock LPR stolen / damaged

	Hi @Flock Safety Support support@flocksafety.com   - following up for Detective DeWitt to get next steps on broken camera. Thank you 

	 

	On Thu, May 29, 2025 at 8:10?AM DEWITT Derek A <DDeWitt@eugene-or.gov DDeWitt@eugene-or.gov > wrote:

		Good morning,

		 

		One of Flocks poles was sawed in half.  The half pole and camera were located nearby.  The camera appears intact and free of damage.  The solar panel was stolen.  I have a few questions related to this. 

		 

		The location is �P#043 W 29th Ave @ Willamette St WB.  Serial 241217P02100813.

		 

		1.	Is flock a victim in this or are we the victim?  Essentially, who must pay for the solar panel and the new pole installation.  Either way, I need to know the price of the LPR camera, the pole, and the solar panel.  That will impact the charge if and when a suspect is identified.
		2.	The camera showed that it was live for about 24 hours after it was removed from the pole.  I searched and no photos were taken after 3:10 am on 5/28/25.  Once the camera is disconnected, does it not record any additional photos?  Why would it show to have had a �heartbeat� for another 18-24 hours afterwards.
		3.	What�s the process on this moving forward.

		 

		Derek

		 

		Detective D. DeWitt

		Financial Crimes Unit

		Special Weapons and Tactics Team

		Background Investigations Team

		Eugene Police Department

		300 County Club Road

		Eugene, OR 97401

		Work hours: Tuesday - Friday 7:30 a.m. � 5:30 p.m.

		Desk Phone � 541-682-2682

		Work Cell � 541-743-6192



	 

	 

	-- 

	
Gaby Mahoney
Customer Success Manager



 https://www.instagram.com/flocksafety/ 
 <https://gifo.srv.wisestamp.com/s/rfw4/108062/26/trans.png>  flocksafety.com 

	
 https://kesq.com/news/2024/06/24/flock-license-plate-reading-cameras-have-led-to-more-than-30-arrests-says-palm-springs-police-department?utm_campaign=EmailSignature&utm_source=Success&utm_medium=Wisestamp 

	
 

	
 

	 <https://tracy.srv.wisestamp.com/px/wsid/RqGQ2llW1Gw.png> 

	 

	To unsubscribe from this group and stop receiving emails from it, send an email to support+unsubscribe@flocksafety.com support+unsubscribe@flocksafety.com .

	 <https://flocksafety.my.salesforce.com/servlet/servlet.ImageServer?oid=00D6g000003tehf&esid=018Pi00000lSHCZ&from=ext> 
	
	thread::Cj10cO4TIWSiKTb_ac4uLg4::

	 <https://flocksafety.my.salesforce.com/servlet/servlet.ImageServer?oid=00D6g000003tehf&esid=018Pi00000ldkb6&from=ext> 



-- 

	
Gaby Mahoney
Customer Success Manager
